title: Lintrathen Loch Walk Route

nearby.description: Kirriemuir and the Loch of Kinnordy

images.title: Mike Pennington / Loch of Lintrathen, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Loch of Lintrathen. The loch has been the main water supply for the city of Dundee and Angus since 1875.

images.title: Alan Morrison / The Overflow Water leaves Lintrathen Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Overflow Water leaves Lintrathen Reservoir. The water then continues as the Melgam Water.

images.title: Trish Steel [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Telephone box, Bridgend of Lintrathen

images.title: Alan Morrison / The Melgam Water cascades down over the rocks at Bridgend of Lintrathen Village, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Melgam Water cascades down over the rocks at Bridgend of Lintrathen Village. Photo taken from the road bridge at Bridgend of Lintrathen Village.

images.title: Nicholas Mutton / Bridge at Bridgend of Linthathen
images.caption: Bridge at Bridgend of Linthathen.

images.title: Bird hide on the Loch of Lintrathen by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bird hide on the Loch of Lintrathen

images.title: Whooper swans on the Loch of Lintrathen by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Whooper swans on the Loch. One of many different bird species you can see on the loch.

images.title: Dominic Dawn Harry and Jacob Paterson / Loch of Lintrathen
images.caption: A view from the southern end of the lake.

description: This lovely reservoir in Angus is a lovely place for a short stroll and some birdwatching. The loch is surrounded by attractive woodland and a number of bird hides. Here you can look out for wildlife including osprey, otter and various wildfowl. To continue your walking in the area head north to Backwater Reservoir . There's a nice circular trail running round the water and the opportunity to pick up the long distance Cateran Trail nearby.
